ONLY available as part of a PV complete package. 600 € federal funding not yet deducted. See details and financing examples in the planning assistant.

title: Monitoring - How Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor Work?
answer: The sensor is installed directly in the electrical distribution box by the zholar installation partner and connected to the existing customer-side WiFi network. It then automatically transmits electrical measurements to the secure BE Cloud platform. After being installed in the fuse box and connected to the WiFi network, the sensor is activated in the BE.SpareFlo app and immediately and automatically begins collecting data on the electrical flows and transmits this data for analysis and evaluation directly to the cloud platform.

title: Monitoring - What is the Energy Monitoring Sensor?
answer: The Energy Monitoring Sensor is an innovative sensor that enables intelligent energy measurement in apartments and houses. Specifically, the sensor helps to efficiently monitor electricity consumption and identify energy saving potentials across devices.

title: Monitoring - How secure is the communication between the Energy Monitoring Sensor and the BE Cloud Platform?
answer: The communication between the Energy Monitoring Sensor and the BE-Cloud is secured by the TLS protocol (Transport Layer Security) v1.2, which meets the industry standard for security protocols. This ensures your data is protected at all times during transmission.

title: Monitoring - How Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor Work?
answer: Once the Energy Monitoring Sensor has been installed in the electrical distribution box, it accurately records voltage and current over 10,000 times per second. These data are sent to the BE-Cloud and subsequently processed or evaluated in the BE.SpareFlo app application.

title: Monitoring - What is Special About the Energy Monitoring Sensor?
answer: The event-based energy monitoring sensor is easy to install as it does not require cables or batteries and is magnetically powered. Unlike time-based sensors, this one sends values based on events, leading to precise measurements with a max deviation of 5%. Additionally, our solution is cost-effective and user-friendly.

title: Monitoring - How is the Energy Monitoring Sensor Installed?
answer: The three-phase energy monitoring sensor can be easily installed in your fuse box without major interruptions to the power supply. The current transformer is placed around the phase cable and the voltage sensors are magnetically attached to the appropriate connections of the circuit breaker. Alternatively, hard wiring is also possible. The inconspicuous sensor fits into most fuse boxes and is installed and activated for you by a zholar partner.

title: Monitoring - How Much Electricity Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor Consume?
answer: The power consumption of the sensor is less than 1 watt, which equates to about 0.72 kWh per month and is therefore negligible.

title: Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor have EU certification?
answer: The sensor has the safety certificates of the European Union (EU) for operation in Europe.

title: Monitoring - What happens to the collected data if the Energy Monitoring Sensor is no longer connected to the internet? (Internet outage)
answer: The Energy Monitoring Sensor is capable of storing the last 16 events in the absence of an active internet connection.

title: Monitoring - How Often Does the Energy Monitoring Sensor Send the Collected Data to the Cloud?
answer: The Energy Monitoring Sensor operates on an event-based system, meaning it sends an event every time the RMS value of the current changes by more than 200 mA. The Energy Monitoring Sensor also sends time-based information to the BE-Cloud every minute.

title: Monitoring - What is the monthly data usage of the Energy Monitoring Sensor?
answer: Usually about 36 MB per month.

title: Monitoring - How Long is Data Stored in the BE.SpareFlo Cloud?
answer: The collected data is continuously stored in the BE Cloud to provide meaningful analyses and reports regarding your energy consumption and production behavior.

title: Monitoring - Will I Also Receive Documentation?
answer: Of course! After the installation and handover of the ready-to-use storage, the installation is checked by zholar based on the completion report of the zholar installation partner. Then we send you the entire documentation.

title: Monitoring - How Does Live Electricity Consumption Monitoring Work?
answer: The live monitoring of power consumption works through the Energy Monitoring Sensor installed in the electrical distribution box. The sensor continuously measures the current power consumption in real time, distinguishing between different consumption levels such as standby, normal, and intensive. By continuously monitoring power consumption, you can track your energy use in real time to identify inefficient devices or behaviors and achieve targeted energy savings. The live monitoring data is captured by the Energy Monitoring Sensor and transferred to the BE Cloud platform. Within the BE Cloud platform, the data is analyzed using algorithms to provide a comprehensive overview of current energy consumption.

title: Monitoring - How and Where Are My Data Secured?
answer: Your data is hosted at Amazon Web Services (AWS) in Europe, an industry-leading company in the field of security and data protection, which offers a range of advanced access, encryption, and login features. All information you provide to us is anonymized and stored on our secure servers. We do not access customer content and only use it for the purpose legally required for maintaining the services and providing these services to our customers and their end users.

title: Monitoring - What are the minimum system requirements for using the BE.SpareFlo App?
answer: The application is available for free download on the App Store for iOS 16.0 and on the Google Play Store for Android. The zholar solution provides full access to all features for 12 months.

title: Monitoring - What Features Does the BE.SpareFlo App Offer?
answer: All-In-One Application: All energy flows that occur within the household (energy consumption, energy production & energy storage) are displayed and stored in just one app. Monitoring: Monitoring of electricity consumption, PV production, battery storage, and electricity procurement from the public grid. General functionalities: Commissioning assistant & user registration, "Explore" information area, master data maintenance (electricity price, API connections, support functions, etc.)

title: Monitoring - How Does the BE.SpareFlo App Work?
answer: To use the BE.SpareFlo app, the following technical requirements must be met: the use of the application requires the acquisition of the zholar inverter (Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1, SUN2000-10KTL-M1) or the Energy Monitoring Sensor (three-phase sensor) - both are essential for the collection and analysis of the electricity flows occurring in the household and thus for the main functions of the application. Without the mentioned and correctly installed and activated hardware components, all functionalities listed in the section Scope of Performance & Specifications are not usable. In addition, an active Wi-Fi internet connection is needed in close

title: Monitoring - How Can I Save Money or Energy Through the BE.SpareFlo App?
answer: The BE.SpareFlo app allows you to better understand your electricity consumption on a daily and monthly basis by displaying and visually explaining the energy flows occurring in your household in near real-time. BE.SpareFlo helps you to understand your energy consumption even better. You can also find out if you are using too many devices at the same time, if you should have left a technical device switched on when leaving your apartment or house, or if you should reduce the consumption of permanently switched-on devices (standby). Additionally, you can identify your consumption peaks and estimate the best time for doing laundry, washing dishes, etc.

title: Monitoring - I don't have a smartphone. Can I use the app on a computer?
answer: The BE.SpareFlo app is currently available for use via smartphone (iOS, Google PlayStore).

title: Monitoring - How Long Does It Take for the Algorithm to Recognize All My Devices?
answer: The Energy Monitoring Sensor or the BE.SpareFlo app automatically recognizes your most important device categories, without you having to worry about it. The division into the different device categories is technically available from the next day or from midnight. In order to create meaningful analyses and technically correct assignments over a longer period of time, the algorithm learns and interprets your energy consumption behavior over several weeks.

title: Can the Energy Monitoring Sensor or the BE.SpareFlo App Recognize Multiple Devices of the Same Type?
answer: Yes, the Energy Monitoring Sensor or the BE.SpareFlo app is capable of recognizing multiple devices of the same type, but it groups them in the same category. For example, if you have two washing machines, they will automatically be grouped in the "Washing Machine" category.

title: Monitoring - What device categories can your power consumption be broken down into?
answer: Currently, your total consumption is broken down into the following device categories: air conditioner, dishwasher, electric boiler, electric heater, electric stove, electric vehicle, refrigerator, freezer, clothes dryer, washing machine. Depending on the types of devices you have at home, some devices that have a very similar electric current curve are summarized in the report. For example, an electric oven and an electric stove are listed in the "Kitchen" category. We are constantly expanding the list of devices we can monitor, so more devices will be available soon.

title: Monitoring - How are the costs calculated for individual devices/device groups?
answer: In the BE.SpareFlo app, you can store your current electricity price. Based on this price, the costs for each device or device category are determined. You always have the option to update the electricity price in the menu. Please note that the cost calculation is based on the assumption that the electricity is 100% sourced from the grid. If you produce your own electricity, for example through your photovoltaic system, this is currently not offset in the app.

title: Monitoring - What do I need to do if the number of residents changes?
answer: If the number of residents in your household changes, you can easily adjust this in the menu or in your profile within the app.

title: Monitoring - How can I update my device list?
answer: You can add or remove devices in your household at any time through the menu, whether they are already there or newly added. The algorithm needs some time to process these changes and adjust the device list and device categories accordingly.

title: Monitoring - Where can I change my electricity rate?
answer: To change your electricity tariff, please go to the "My Electricity Price" section in the app menu. There you can update both the consumption price and the production price.

title: Monitoring - How can I contact support if I need help or have questions?
answer: If you need help or have any questions, the zholar support team is available at support@zholar.de.

title: Monitoring - How is my energy balance calculated?
answer: The energy balance in the BE.SpareFlo app shows you the number of kilowatt-hours (kWh) currently being drawn from the power grid. However, it's important to note that the actual energy consumption billed may vary from the energy supplier. The values shown in the app do not replace the billing by the energy supplier, but only serve as an approximate guideline.

title: Monitoring - How can I have my account or my data deleted?
answer: To have your account or your data deleted, you can contact support at any time. To do this, send an email to support@zholar.de.

title: Monitoring - Are there any future features or updates planned for the app?
answer: Yes, the app and the underlying algorithms are continuously improved and optimized. In the future, expansions and updates are planned to integrate additional APIs, such as electric vehicle charging solutions. This will allow information and features from various manufacturers to be bundled into a central all-in-one application, eliminating the need for additional manufacturer-specific applications. The goal is to create a manufacturer-independent, central application that allows a collective display and control of all energy flows. Future functions and updates for the app include the following roadmap: Energy Insights: Direct insight into energy consumption at the device level to better understand energy use and identify potential cost savings. Reports: Weekly and monthly energy reports in-app and via newsletter (available from summer 2023). Energy saving tips: General energy saving tips

title: Monitoring - Can I Use the App Without the Energy Monitoring Sensor, a PV System, or a Battery Storage?
answer: Without the purchase of a zholar inverter (Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1 or technically comparable) or the Energy Monitoring Sensor (Three-phase sensor), the use of the application is not possible. The zholar inverter and the Energy Monitoring Sensor are essential for the collection and analysis (using algorithms) of the electricity flows occurring in the household and thus for the main functions of the application. Therefore, the purchase of the hardware components (storage not mandatory) is necessary to be able to use the application and its functions.

title: Monitoring - Which inverters can currently be integrated into the app via API?
answer: Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1

title: Can I also display the values of my existing PV system, which I did not purchase from zholar, in the BE.SpareFlo app?
answer: Currently, only values from the zholar inverter (Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1) can be displayed in the app. In addition, the system must have been commissioned by a zholar installation partner and assigned to the zholar account in the inverter manufacturer's online portal (e.g., Huawei FusionSolar) in order for the inverter data to be displayed in the BE.SpareFlo app.

title: Monitoring - Why aren't my production data from my PV system or battery storage displayed in real time?
answer: The production data from your PV system or your battery storage is not displayed in real time due to technical limitations of the manufacturer (in this case, Huawei). The measurement or query and display of data in the BE.Spare Flo app occurs at intervals of 5 minutes. This means that it may take a few minutes for changes in production or in relation to your battery storage to become visible in the app. We are continuously working to improve the data update and keep the time delay as minimal as possible.

title: Does the BE.SpareFlo App or the energy reports from the app replace my final billing from my electricity supplier?
answer: The BE.SpareFlo app, and specifically the energy reporting of the app, does not replace your final bill from your electricity supplier. The values displayed in the app are guidelines and may differ from the actual values billed by the energy supplier. The app is primarily designed to provide an overview of energy consumption and to help save energy. However, it never replaces the actual billing by the energy supplier.

title: Monitoring - Who is Installing the Energy Monitoring Sensor in my Switch Cabinet?
answer: The installation, activation, and configuration are carried out by the Zholar installation partner, usually during the PV installation.

title: Monitoring - When is the payment made to Zholar?
answer: 100% upon completion of the installation and handover to the customer. In the case of credit purchase, payment instruction by the financing bank Deutsche Bank AG.

title: Monitoring - What happens if the energy monitoring solution cannot be installed?
answer: If the described structural conditions are met, this case is generally unlikely. If it does occur, the extension will not be installed (regardless of the installation of the PV system) and there will be no costs for you.

title: Monitoring - Can the Energy Monitoring Solution be Ordered Without a Zholar PV System?
answer: This extension is only available in combination with the order of a zholar PV system.

title: Monitoring - Can I cancel the order of the energy monitoring solution without affecting the order of the PV system?
answer: Essentially, your zholar order is a comprehensive solution consisting of one of our PV packages and the offered extensions, such as energy monitoring. Modifications to your order afterwards are generally possible. In such a case, contact the zholar support team at support@zholar.de to clarify the details.

title: Monitoring - What do I need to do if I want to purchase the zholar Energy Monitoring Solution?
answer: Visit our website www.zholar.de and click on the "Start Planning" button to configure your PV system and also order this extension. Please note: Our energy monitoring solution is only available in combination with a zholar PV system.

title: Monitoring - What happens if I order the energy monitoring solution as an extension of my zholar PV system and then there is a cancellation of the PV order?
answer: The energy monitoring is an extension of your initial PV order. So if your PV order is canceled for any reason (e.g., due to your revocation/withdrawal or due to a technical cancellation by zholar), your order for the energy monitoring solution is also immediately canceled.

title: Monitoring - Will there be additional costs on top of the purchase price?
answer: The scope of services of the energy monitoring solution offered by zholar is described in the product sheet. If additional services are needed (e.g., if there is insufficient space in the distribution box), our installation partner will inform you of the necessary additional services and the costs incurred. The commissioning and billing, if necessary, will take place directly between you and the installation partner.

title: Monitoring - What Structural Requirements Should Be Considered?
answer: You can find the prerequisites for installing the Energy Monitoring Sensor in the Energy Monitoring product sheet.

title: Monitoring - How long can I use the BE.SpareFlo App?
answer: The BE.SpareFlo app can be used with full functionality for a period of 12 months from the time it is activated. After these 12 months, it is necessary to renew the subscription with the app operator in order to continue using the full functionality of the app.

title: What are the usage costs for the BE.SpareFlo app after the initial 12 months of operation (included in the zholar package) have expired?
answer: With the zholar package, you automatically have full access to the app for 12 months free of charge. After that, you can easily extend the subscription as you wish and continue to enjoy the benefits for a few euros per month. We will inform you about the exact terms and conditions in due time.

title: Friends - What is the "zholar Friends" Referral Program?
answer: The "zholar Friends" referral program is our referral program for zholar customers. As a zholar customer, you will automatically receive an email after the first partial invoice has been sent, informing you about our zholar Friends referral program. The personal referral code included in the email can be directly forwarded or easily shared via WhatsApp, SMS, or email with family, friends, and neighbors. Once the installation of the zholar PV system has been successfully completed by the referred person ("Referee"), you and the referred person will receive a reward of 150 € each as a thank you.

title: Friends - When and how do I receive the referral code?
answer: The email for the Zholar Friends Referral Program, including your individual referral code, will be automatically sent to you as a Zholar customer after the first partial invoice is dispatched.

title: Friends - Can I also recommend Zholar without being a customer yet?
answer: Of course, we appreciate every recommendation! However, the "zholar Friends" referral program is exclusively a referral program for existing zholar customers. If you are not yet a customer, you can become one here and recommend other zholar customers. After successful installation of the zholar PV system ordered based on your recommendation, you and the recommended person will each receive a bonus of 150 €.

title: Friends - Who can participate in the "zholar Friends" Referral Program?
answer: Anyone who meets the participation conditions, while we reserve the right to change the participation conditions or end the "zholar Friends" referral program at any time. To use the "zholar Friends" referral program, you must already be a zholar customer.

title: Friends - What is the Zholar referral code and how long is it valid?
answer: The Zholar referral code is a combination of numbers starting with the prefix "EBL". It is linked to the email address used to place an order with Zholar. The referral code is valid as long as we offer the "Zholar Friends" referral program according to the terms and conditions in their current version. In addition to the referral code, a referral link is also created for you, which contains your referral code (e.g. https://zholar.de/planer/?aktionscode=EBL123456789). You can share this referral link directly with the people you want to recruit.

title: Friends - Where can I find my zholar referral code?
answer: As an existing zholar customer, you can find your personal zholar referral code (example: EBL123456789) in the email from zholar with the subject: "Referring pays off double - zholar Friends Program."

title: Friends - What do I need the zholar referral code for?
answer: You need the zholar referral code (e.g., EBL123456789) so that we can track your referral in our system and qualify you for the referral bonus. Simply pass your referral code to your friends, family members, and neighbors or share your referral link. You can find the referral code or referral link in the zholar email on the topic "zholar Friends Program" after receiving the 1st partial invoice.

title: Friends - How can I recruit someone?
answer: Simply pass on your zholar referral code. The person you want to recruit as a zholar customer can easily enter your zholar referral code in our planning form at https://zholar.de/planer/ in the section "Your zholar planning overview" under "Your zholar referral code". Alternatively, you can also simply share your referral link with the person you want to recruit as a zholar customer, for example via email or WhatsApp. Your referral link leads directly to our planning form, where your referral code is already stored.

title: Friends - What rewards are there?
answer: Both you as the referrer (existing zholar customer) and the person you referred (new customer) will each receive a referral bonus of €150. The condition is that the zholar PV system was successfully installed at the referred person's location. The referral bonus for you as the referrer and the referred new customer will be transferred to the respective registered account.

title: Friends - When will I receive my referral bonus, when will it be paid out?
answer: After a successful referral in accordance with the terms of participation, both you as the referrer and the recommended person as the new customer will each receive a premium of 150 €. Once the zholar PV system has been successfully installed at the recruited new customer's location, the payout will be made after approval by zholar within 14 days to the deposited account.

title: Friends - Will I be notified as soon as I qualify for the referral bonus?
answer: Yes, you will receive an email when the person you referred has placed an order with zholar. Additionally, you will receive an email containing your credit for the payout of the referral bonus.

title: Friends - Can I Recruit Family Members?
answer: Yes, of course, you can refer family members. Participants must be at least 18 years old and have a permanent residence in Austria. Employees of Zholar are excluded from participating. You can find details in the terms and conditions.

title: Friends - Can I recruit myself?
answer: No. This also applies when it comes to the installation of a PV system or a power storage unit for an additional house (e.g., vacation home).

title: Friends - Who Can I Contact for Questions?
answer: If you have any questions about the zholar Friends Program, feel free to contact support@zholar.de.

title: Friends - Is there a maximum number of people who can be recruited?
answer: We grant a maximum referral bonus of EUR 1,500 per advertiser and calendar year, which corresponds to 10 recruited new customers. If you recruit new customers beyond this, a corresponding referral bonus must be clarified in advance with zholar.

title: Balcony Power Plant - I live in a residential complex. Is it allowed to set up or hang PV panels on the balcony?
answer: This depends on your housing complex and you should ask your landlord or cooperative if in doubt. Many housing complexes allow a privacy screen (including one like ours with function), others do not. However, anything that is installed within your balcony railing is up to you.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Do I need to register my mini PV system with the network operator?
answer: PV systems of this category do not need to be approved by the network operator; however, they must be reported. Please inquire about this with your network operator. Most network operators provide a simple form for this. In case you do not get any information from your network operator, we provide you with a template. If you have chosen the zholar installation service, we will take over the notification to your network operator for you.

title: Balcony Power Plant - What Orientation Should My Balcony Have?
answer: The optimal orientation for your balcony is to the south, as this yields the best results. However, systems facing east or west can also achieve reasonably good performance. A north-facing orientation is not recommended for efficiency reasons.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Will there be additional costs to me beyond the purchase price?
answer: If a standard-compliant installation requires additional adjustments, such as stabilizing the balcony railings or changes to the customer's electrical system, our installation partner will bring this to your attention. These notes are provided as part of the installation service, if you have booked it. Otherwise, there are no additional costs within the scope of the zholar solution.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Can I Order the Zholar SolMate?
answer: You can place your order directly here: www.zholar.de/balkonkraftwerk On this page, you will also find all the information about the product.

title: Balcony Power Plant - I Don't Have a Credit Card for Payment.
answer: As an alternative to a credit card, you can also pay via EPS transfer, and all common Austrian commercial banks are supported.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Can I Cancel My Order?
answer: Yes. You can cancel your order without giving any reason up to 14 days after delivery. You can find details in the cancellation policy and in our terms and conditions.

title: Balcony Power Plant - I have questions about the ordering process – who can I contact?
answer: The zholar Support Team is happy to assist you via email at support@zholar.de. You can book a phone consultation HERE on our website.

title: Balcony Power Plant - What Happens After the Order?
answer: Order with free delivery: After your order, your Zholar SolMate will be configured and shipped according to your preferences. You will receive the shipping confirmation with a link to track the package via email, so you know when your SolMate will arrive. Order with Zholar installation service: Your SolMate will be sent directly to your installation partner. Once it has arrived, you will be notified by email and the partner will call you to arrange an installation appointment. After successful installation, the installation partner will dispose of the packaging material.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Zholar SolMate
answer: Data Sheet SolMate Declarations of Conformity User Manual

title: Balcony Power Plant - Modules
answer: Data Sheet Module

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Long Does the Installation of the Zholar SolMate Take?
answer: The assembly is quite simple due to the well-thought-out system and the included assembly instructions. And depending on the assembly situation, it takes about 1-2 hours.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Wall Mounting System
answer: Supplement for Installation Data Sheet Operating Instructions (Manufacturer)

title: Balcony Power Plant - Installation Instructions
answer: SolMate - Balcony Videos - Photo Guide Wall - Photo Guide Steel Bracket - Photo Guide

title: Balcony Power Plant - Balcony Mounting System
answer: Standard installation accessory (adjustable size)

title: Balcony Power Plant - What Happens to the Generated but Unused Electricity?
answer: The unused electricity, i.e., the surplus, is fed into the power grid. You do not receive any compensation for this fed-in electricity from the electricity provider, but due to the integrated storage, this amount is low anyway and the focus is on the self-consumption of the generated solar power. This increases your electricity cost savings.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Floor Mounting System
answer: Installation Supplement

title: Balcony Power Plant - What is Included in Our Package?
answer: Zholar SolMate is a complete package and consists of the following components: 2,3 or 4 dual-glass PV modules, mounting system optionally for wall, balcony or floor mounting DC connection cable SolMate with 800W grid feed-in and 1.44 kWh storage, WLAN MySolMate App (via AppStore) delivery and optional installation service.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Does SolMate Comply with the OVE E 8001 Standards, Gate Generator A?
answer: Yes. As a provider of SolMate systems, compliance with the mandatory ÖNORM 8001 is crucial for us. This standard is naturally met by our systems. In addition, our systems comply with all relevant safety standards.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Long is My Warranty?
answer: We pass on the manufacturer's warranties for all components. Our modules have a performance guarantee of at least 25 years. The Zholar SolMate has a product warranty of 2 years. You can find the warranty conditions here: (https://www.eet.energy/garantiebedingungen/)

title: Balcony Power Plant - What are the Mounting Options for Photovoltaic Panels?
answer: The photovoltaic panels can be mounted in the following ways, depending on the choice of mounting system: -Balcony hooks for hanging on the balcony railing -Wall rails for screwing onto vertical surfaces (house wall, garden sheds, fence...) -Ground mounts

title: Balcony Power Plant - Are there subsidies for the Zholar SolMate?
answer: At the federal level, the subsidy program for PV systems up to 35kWp has been replaced by the VAT exemption. The Zholar SolMate is exempt from VAT! Often, there are additional subsidies at the state or municipal level.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Who can I turn to if something is broken?
answer: In the event of a malfunction or damage, we are of course available for repairs or replacement of the device. Please contact us by email at support@zholar.de.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Can the storage unit withstand all weather conditions outdoors?
answer: The casing is designed for protected outdoor use and can be left outside in any weather. The SolMate is splash-proof according to IP44 and should be placed in an area protected from rain.

title: Balcony Power Plant - If the power goes out in my apartment, will SolMate still supply electricity?
answer: No. For safety reasons, SolMate automatically disconnects from the network. However, SolMate has a built-in outlet that can be used for autonomous emergency power supply. So, if the power goes out in your house, you can continue to supply important consumers with it.

title: Balcony Power Plant - When Will My SolMate Pay Off?
answer: This naturally depends on consumption and electricity prices! With SolMate and four connected panels, you save approximately 1200 kWh per year. At 50 cents per kWh (energy price including taxes, levies, and grid charges), that would be a savings of 600 € per year, or in other words: the payback period in this case is 5-6 years. In addition, SolMate provides an integrated emergency power supply, so the device pays for itself twice over in the event of a longer power outage.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Do I Need a Smartphone to Control My SolMate?
answer: No, you don't need a smartphone to control your SolMate. However, using the MySolMate app significantly simplifies the control.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Does the battery life suffer from the device being outside in both summer and winter?
answer: Unlike the lithium-cobalt dioxide batteries commonly used in smartphones, lithium iron phosphate batteries are particularly durable and less sensitive to temperature fluctuations. Even when used outdoors, they guarantee a long lifespan. The battery functions optimally at 20°C and achieves the longest lifespan at this temperature.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Does Grid Operation Work?
answer: In grid operation, the intelligent measurement technology detects the power consumption in the household and feeds the generated power as needed. Excess power is stored. The integrated socket on the SolMate can be used in grid operation like a regular socket.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Does Island Operation Work?
answer: In island mode, power can be drawn from the SolMate via the socket. A maximum of one Class I device (device with metal housing) may be plugged into the socket, but several Class II devices may be connected simultaneously. SolMate can supply devices up to 1000 watts (2000 watts startup power for 0.5 seconds) in island mode. The SolMate generates a pure sine wave power signal, which means that most consumers can be operated without any problems.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Can I Use the Zholar SolMate Exclusively in Island Operation?
answer: Yes, in principle, this is possible. Please note: If you use SolMate in island mode and still consume the generated electricity every day and empty the storage, then that's fine. However, if you continuously have your storage in island mode with connected solar panels, the battery is permanently charged to the maximum, which can lead to battery degradation.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Does SolMate Only Supply Devices on One Power Phase?
answer: SolMate physically feeds into only one phase and also only measures this one phase. However, the balancing is done across all three phases. Typically, the consumers are distributed across the three phases. If there is a larger, constant consumer on another phase, the MySolMate app allows for the setting of a constant base consumption that should always be fed in.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Many Panels Can I Connect to SolMate?
answer: Up to 4 panels can be connected to the SolMate.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How long are the SolMate cables and is there a possibility for extension?
answer: By default, the cables from the panels to the storage are 5m long, and from the storage to the outlet are 2m long. If this is too short for you, you can use a standard extension cord to bridge the distance between SolMate and the outlet.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Much Energy Does the Balcony Power Plant Generate?
answer: Depending on the roof orientation, location, and shading situation, the balcony power plant delivers the following average energy yield per year: 2 modules: approx. 850 kWh, 3 modules: approx. 1,100 kWh, 4 modules: approx. 1,500 kWh.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Where Can I See How Much Energy My PV System Produces?
answer: You can view the production data of the Zholar SolMate at any time on your smartphone via the MySolMate app. For this, your SolMate needs to be connected to your Wi-Fi.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Does the System Only Produce Electricity When the Sun Shines?
answer: The high-quality dual-glass modules, which can capture sunlight on both sides, can also generate electricity in cloudy conditions. Of course, the power production is significantly higher with direct sunlight.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Is there still voltage at the plug after pulling the power cable?
answer: If you disconnect your SolMate from your household outlet, there will be no more voltage. The built-in inverters have integrated, certified safety precautions that ensure that voltage is only present when a power grid is detected. If no power grid is detected, the voltage at the plug is switched off in less than 200 milliseconds.

title: Balcony Power Plant - What Maintenance Costs Are Involved?
answer: The Zholar SolMate is maintenance-free.

title: Balcony Power Plant - How Long Can the Electricity Be Stored?
answer: The storage unit has a capacity of 1.44 kWh and the energy stays in the storage until you use it, storage losses are minimal. So, if you were to actually not consume any power, the battery would remain fully charged for many days to weeks if the storage is turned off. If the storage is turned on and no new energy is coming from the sun, your SolMate will remain active for 1-2 weeks and then finally be empty. Basically, the storage is intended as a buffer - during the day (when the sun is shining) it is filled with excess energy and at night this stored electricity is consumed.

title: Balcony Power Plant - Where are the cable connections on the module and how long are the cables?
answer: The cable connections of the module are located on the left and right in the middle. The cable length is 1.2 meters each.

title: Wallbox - What is a Wallbox?
answer: A Wallbox is a charging station for electric vehicles, typically mounted on a wall, that allows for a safe and fast charging of the vehicle. In our case, it is a "smart" Wallbox that, as a key additional feature, also allows for "PV surplus charging", thus controlling the charging of the electric car in such a way that, if desired, only the unused solar power from one's own PV system is used to charge the car.

title: Wallbox - What Charging Speeds are Possible?
answer: Our Smart Wallbox can generally charge from 1.4-11 kW. The upper limit is clarified with the network operator as part of the network access application, which zholar takes over. The goal is to avoid network provision costs for the customer.

title: Wallbox - How Does Charging with a Wallbox Work?
answer: Our wallbox has three operating modes. Manual charging with the set power whenever a vehicle is connected, time-controlled charging in defined periods (e.g., always at night), and PV surplus charging as the most efficient and innovative form of charging.

title: Wallbox - What Advantages Does a Wallbox Offer?
answer: A wallbox provides a faster charging time compared to conventional outlets. It ensures a safer and more reliable charge. In the case of our Zholar Smart Wallbox, the automatic and convenient PV surplus charging maximizes the self-consumption of the generated solar power and reduces the grid reference for charging the electric car.

title: Wallbox - Do I Need a Wallbox for My Electric Vehicle?
answer: A wallbox is not absolutely necessary, but it offers many advantages over charging at a conventional outlet, especially if you want to regularly and quickly charge your electric vehicle. In particular, for automatic PV surplus charging, the wallbox is essential.

title: Wallbox - What Charging Capacities Do We Recommend for the Smart Wallbox?
answer: The choice of charging power depends on various factors, including the available grid connection power, the vehicle battery capacity, the charging duration, and the individual preferences of the customer. We generally recommend slower charging speeds up to a maximum of 11 KW and surplus PV charging whenever possible to maximize your own advantage.

title: Wallbox - Can I Install a Wallbox Outdoors?
answer: Yes, many wall boxes are suitable for outdoor installation and have appropriate protection against weather conditions. However, it is recommended to install the wall box in a protected location to increase its longevity.

title: Wallbox - How is a Wallbox Installed?
answer: The installation of a wallbox must be carried out by a qualified electrician. This involves connecting the wallbox to the power grid and, depending on the model, also to the WLAN for control and monitoring. The zholar installation partners, as licensed and experienced electrical companies, are very familiar with this and take over the turnkey installation.

title: Wallbox - Is there a subsidy available?
answer: Yes, through the Climate and Energy Fund, private individuals can obtain a subsidy of €600 per Wallbox installation. The grant application and the entire grant process is handled by zholar for our customers. The grant is paid out directly to the customer by the grant provider after installation.

title: Wallbox - Is the Wallbox also available for purchase on credit?
answer: Is the wallbox also available for purchase on credit (financing) when bought together with the PV system? In the case of retrofitting an existing system, only immediate purchase is available. In this case, the down payment is made immediately before installation and the remaining payment immediately after completion.

title: Wallbox - Can Additional Costs Arise During Installation?
answer: We have defined our turnkey complete package to cover a typical assembly situation. However, if for example, more power length between the wallbox and fuse box (>10 m) should be required, the excess length will be charged as an additional service by the zholar installation partner. The need for this will be discussed before the installation and the customer has a free right of withdrawal at any time.

title: Wallbox - Can I Install a Wallbox Myself?
answer: The installation of a wallbox must be carried out by a qualified electrician to ensure a safe installation in accordance with applicable regulations.

title: Wallbox - Do You Need to Inform Your Network Provider About the Wallbox?
answer: Before installing the Wallbox, a network access application is absolutely necessary from the network operator. This is taken care of by Zholar.

title: Wallbox - What are the usual requirements of network operators for the installation of a Wallbox?
answer: Maximum Charging Power: The maximum charging power of the wallbox may be limited by the network operator to avoid overloads in the network. For example, this could be a limit of 11 kW (possible in most cases), depending on the network infrastructure.

title: Maintenance - How does a scheduled maintenance procedure work?
answer: Maintenance appointments are scheduled at least one month in advance. First, a visual inspection of the main components of the PV system is carried out by the technician. Subsequently, the module strings are measured. The results are recorded in a maintenance log.

title: Maintenance - What Services Does the Maintenance Package Include?
answer: Scheduled maintenance of the PV system in the 5th and 10th year after commissioning by zholar, as well as event-/disturbance-related maintenance measures of the PV system as needed for a duration of 10 years from commissioning.

title: Maintenance - Can I possibly withdraw from ordering the maintenance package without affecting my order for the PV system?
answer: Basically, the zholar order is a complete solution from one of our PV packages and offered extensions such as maintenance. Adjustments to the order afterwards are basically contact in such a case the zholar support team at support@zholar.de to clarify the details.

title: Maintenance - What is the Scope and Procedure of Fault-Related Maintenance?
answer: After the error message and description of the error image by the customer, an initial attempt to troubleshoot was made through remote access/telephone customer service. If it cannot be resolved in this way, troubleshooting is carried out by a zholar technician on site.

title: Maintenance - When is the payment made to Zholar?
answer: 100% upon completion of the installation and handover of the operational PV system. In the case of credit purchase, payment instruction by the financing bank Deutsche Bank AG.

title: Storage - What do I need to do if I want to purchase a zholar storage?
answer: Visit our website www.zholar.de and click on the "Start Planning" button to configure your PV system and order the appropriate storage. Please note: our ZholarSissi storage is only available in combination with a zholar PV system.

title: Storage - What happens if I order a storage unit in addition to the PV system and then the PV order is cancelled?
answer: The storage is an extension of your initial PV order. So if your PV order is canceled, for any reason (e.g., due to your withdrawal/withdrawal or due to a technical cancellation by zholar), your storage order also immediately falls apart.

title: Storage - Can I cancel the storage order without affecting the PV system order?
answer: Essentially, your zholar order is a complete solution consisting of one of our PV packages and the offered extensions, such as the ZholarSissi storage. Adjustments to your order afterwards are generally possible. In such a case, contact the zholar support team at support@zholar.de to clarify the details.

title: Storage - Can the storage be ordered without a Zholar PV system?
answer: Our ZholarSissi storage complete package is only available in combination with a Zholar PV system.

title: Storage - I already have a Zholar PV system on my roof or will receive my Zholar PV system soon. Can I order a storage unit afterwards?
answer: Yes, you can! Contact the zholar support team at support@zholar.de to define an appropriate course of action.

title: Storage - Is the storage compatible with other inverters?
answer: The memory used is compatible with your Huawei SUN2000-3KTL-M1, SUN2000-5KTL-M1, SUN2000-8KTL-M1, and SUN2000-10KTL-M1 type zholar inverter.

title: Storage - What is the Right Storage Size?
answer: Basically, the correct size of the storage depends on your power consumption and the size of your PV system. In an average case, for our PV systems zholarMax (approx. 3 kWp) and zholarMarry (approx. 5 kWh), a ZholarSissi storage with 5 kWh is a good choice. If you have a slightly higher consumption, especially during the night hours, or if the larger PV system zholarMarry XL (approx. 8 kWp) or Zholar Marie XXL (approx. 10 kWp) is installed, you can further increase your independence from the public grid by using the storage with 10 kWh capacity or 15 kWh capacity.

title: Storage - What warranty or guarantee provisions apply?
answer: In addition to the statutory warranty, the manufacturer offers a 10-year guarantee.

title: Does the Storage Allow for Emergency Power Supply?
answer: Please note that currently, the storage does not provide emergency power supply or blackout protection. A corresponding technical solution is announced by the manufacturer for the end of 2023-beginning of 2024 (not part of the current zholar scope of services).

title: Storage - How can I view / retrieve the storage status?
answer: You can view the activity of the storage at any time in real-time via the manufacturer's app. The prerequisite for this is appropriate Wi-Fi availability. If your zholar order includes our energy monitoring solution with the "BE SpareFlo Pro" app, you will also find all the information about the storage summarized there (charge level, current charging/discharging power, and range).

title: Storage - Can I use the storage to charge my electric car or operate my heat pump?
answer: In principle, this is possible, however, the capacity of the storage is very small in relation to these consumers (e.g., storage with 10 kWh compared to a medium-sized electric car battery with 50 kWh).

title: Storage - Is there a maintenance package for storage?
answer: A maintenance package specifically for the storage is not provided. However, if your zholar order includes the maintenance package for your PV system, your entire system will be checked as part of this (planned maintenance in the 5th and 10th year), and the storage will also be taken into account.

title: Storage - For what period can I make myself independent from the public network with storage?
answer: This depends on the technical capacity and the actual charge level of the storage, as well as your consumption. An assumed, average night consumption of a total of 3-5 kWh can potentially be covered with a sufficiently charged storage.

title: Storage - Is there also a financing solution for storage?
answer: Yes, together with our financing partner Deutsche Bank AG, we offer an attractive credit purchase solution for your zholar order - 12 years credit term and fixed interest rate.

title: Storage - How long does the loan agreement run?
answer: The term is 12 years.

title: Storage - How Exactly Does Credit Purchase Work?
answer: After completing your zholar order and passing the expert check, you will receive a link via email to finalize your financing directly with our financing partner, UniCredit Bank Austria. This can be done online, or if preferred, you can visit a bank branch. After successful completion of the financing, the bank will inform zholar and the order processing (application for network access, etc.) by zholar will begin. The down payment to be made before the installation (in the amount of the possible subsidy for the product you have chosen) must be paid directly to zholar, the further payments to zholar in connection with your order will be made directly by the bank. From the installation of your zholar system, you pay the agreed installments to the

title: Storage - When are the installments due for a loan purchase?
answer: The first installment is due only after the system has been installed.

title: Storage - To what extent is flexible repayment of the loan possible?
answer: Early repayment or partial repayment is possible under the defined conditions of the loan agreement.

title: Storage - I would like to make a credit purchase at Zholar. Is it possible for another person to close my credit at the bank?
answer: No, unfortunately not. It is important that the Zholar customer is the same person as the bank customer.

title: Storage - What documents need to be provided for the bank's credit check?
answer: Proof of income (the last three pay slips or the latest pension statement), online verification (passport or ID card, smartphone) or in-branch verification (passport, ID card).

title: Storage - How long does the credit check take approximately?
answer: Approximately three bank business days after all documents have been submitted

title: Storage - How Much Space Does the Storage Need?
answer: At least 30cm of space must be free on the left and right of the storage, as well as above. ZholarSissi5: 67cm x 15cm x 60cm ZholarSissi10: 67cm x 15cm x 96cm ZholarSissi15: 67cm x 15cm x 132cm

title: Storage - Is an application to the network operator also necessary for storage and who takes care of it?
answer: Yes, the use of a battery storage system must be reported to your network operator in advance. We will take care of the application for you. It should be noted that the processing time and feedback from the network operator are estimated to take 4 weeks (based on experience).

title: Storage - Is the storage installed together with the PV system?
answer: Basically, storage and PV systems are installed together. In individual cases, it may be that the storage is set up after the PV installation.

title: Storage - How Long Does the Installation of Memory Take?
answer: The installation of the storage takes approximately 3-5 hours. If possible, this is carried out together with the electrical installation of the PV system.

title: Storage - Who Will Install the Storage?
answer: The storage system (just like the zholar PV system) is installed by a zholar installation partner (licensed electrical company). Typically, the installation of the PV system and storage is done together.

title: Storage - Will I also receive documentation?
answer: Of course! After the installation and handover of the ready-to-use storage, the installation is checked by zholar based on the completion report of the zholar installation partner. Subsequently, we will send you the entire documentation consisting of the test report, handover protocol, data sheets, and photo documentation.

title: Storage - When is the payment for the storage made to Zholar?
answer: For an immediate purchase, 50% of the purchase price is to be paid before the storage installation and 50% after the completion of the installation and handover of the operational storage. For a credit purchase, you have to make a down payment to zholar for the storage variant you have chosen before the installation of the storage. The remaining amount is paid directly to zholar by the financing bank (Deutsche Bank AG) after the installation and handover of the operational system, and from this point on, you pay the agreed installments to the bank. The invoicing is usually done together with the PV package. For details, see the product sheet Storage.

title: Storage - 0% Sales Tax – What Does This Mean and Is It Automatically Considered?
answer: The reduction of sales tax to 0% applies to PV systems, storage, and installation - in the course of new construction. This measure replaces federal funding and is limited to two years (until the end of 2025). The sales tax exemption is automatically taken into account in the billing.

title: Storage - What happens if the ordered storage cannot be installed?
answer: If the structural conditions described by zholar are present, it is very unlikely that a storage assembly would not be possible. If this is still the case, your order will be adjusted accordingly and any payments already made will be fully refunded within 14 days. In the case of a credit purchase, the credit amount will be reduced accordingly.

title: Storage - What is the Right Location for Storage? Can Storage be Set Up Outdoors?
answer: Outdoor storage setup is not possible for operational and technical reasons. It must be placed at room temperature in close proximity (i.e., in the same room) to the inverter. Installation in garages may involve additional services that may be chargeable (collision protection necessary). Please also refer to the "Technical Specifications Data Sheet".

title: Storage - What structural requirements should be considered?
answer: You can find the prerequisites for installing a memory in the memory product sheet.

title: Storage - Will there be additional costs on top of the purchase price for me?
answer: The scope of services included in the storage standard package offered by zholar is described in the product sheet. If additional services are needed (e.g., higher cabling effort), our installation partner will inform you of the necessary additional services and the costs incurred. The commissioning and billing, if necessary, will take place directly between you and the installation partner. Of course, you are not obligated to commission these additional services and can withdraw from the contract in this case. In the event of a contract withdrawal, we will refund your already made down payment to zholar within 14 days to your specified account.

title: Storage - Are governmental permissions required for the installation of storage?
answer: Aside from Vienna, zholar is not aware of any building/electrical permit requirements. However, we naturally cannot rule out any changes to legal/regulatory requirements. The submission or preparation of such permits is not part of zholar's scope of services. If necessary, your zholar installation partner will be happy to assist you, and you can directly commission them to provide the corresponding services. The billing will then take place between you and the installation partner.

title: Storage - What is a Huawei Blackout Box FRT?
answer: The Huawei Blackout Box is a special unit that was designed to maintain the power supply of your PV system in case of a power outage. It serves as a backup power supply system and ensures that the power supply to critical consumers - through the PV system or storage - continues to be available even in the event of network failures.

title: Storage - How Does the Huawei Blackout Box Work?
answer: The Blackout Box is connected to your inverter with a power storage unit and stores excess energy that your PV system generates or stores in the battery during normal operation. In the event of a power outage, the Blackout Box can then use this stored energy to maintain the power supply.

title: Storage - How long can the Blackout Box maintain the power supply?
answer: The duration for which the Blackout Box can maintain the power supply depends on various factors, including the size of the power storage, the performance of your PV system, and your individual power consumption. A few hours are quite realistic.

title: Storage - How is the Blackout Box installed?
answer: The installation of the Blackout Box is carried out by the zholar installation partner as a licensed and experienced electrical company. It is connected directly to the inverter and usually requires some additional wiring work. These are included in the zholar package.

title: Storage - What is the Blackout Box Needed For?
answer: The Blackout Box provides protection against power outages and can help maximize the self-consumption of your PV system. It ensures a continuous power supply for your most important consumers, even if the public grid fails. This is implemented through a so-called "PV Point" as a specially designated 230 V outlet.

title: Storage - What Performance Can Be Derived from the Blackout Box?
answer: The PV point can handle up to 3,000W - 3,300W depending on the size of the inverter and the connected battery storage (max. 15.2A).

title: Storage - What is the Structure of the Supply?
answer: A single-phase 230V 50Hz PV-Point connection with a surface-mounted socket for critical consumers is being produced. This is not (as standard) a complete emergency supply for the entire house installation. This can be produced as an additional service, individually adapted to the respective house installation, if desired.

title: Storage - Can Additional Costs Apply?
answer: The zholar package is designed so that a typical installation can be carried out without additional costs. Specifically, if you wish to supply an entire circuit of the house installation instead of the PV point, additional efforts arise, which are communicated by the zholar installation partner if necessary and billed separately by them.

title: Storage - How Likely is a Blackout?
answer: The likelihood of a blackout in Austria is generally low, as the country has a stable power supply. However, unforeseen events such as extreme weather conditions or technical problems can lead to temporary power outages. Therefore, it is advisable to prepare for such contingencies, for example, by installing a blackout box as a backup power supply system.

title: Storage - How long does the switch from grid to emergency power supply take?
answer: The switching time is 5 seconds. This is triggered automatically.

title: Storage - What conditions must be met to install a Blackout Box?
answer: A Huawei inverter with a power storage system must be present (SUN 2000 + LUNA 2000)

title: Storage - Is the Zholar Blackout Box approved in Austria?
answer: Yes, our solution is approved in Austria and is capable of Fault Ride-Through (FRT) as per legal requirements.

title: Downloads - Product Sheet Storage
answer: Download product sheet storage

title: Downloads - Photovoltaic Product Sheet
answer: Download the PV product sheet.

title: Downloads - Product Sheet Blackout Box
answer: Download the product sheet for BlackoutBox

title: Downloads - Energy Monitoring Product Sheet
answer: Download the Energy Monitoring Product Sheet

title: Downloads - Product Sheet PV Maintenance
answer: Download the product maintenance sheet

title: Photovoltaics - How can I register and order?
answer: Visit our website www.zholar.de, learn about our solutions and go through the planning process in a few minutes. After answering a series of simple questions, you can directly configure and order the zholar package that suits you - with the PV system as the base and storage, our innovative energy monitoring and maintenance package as possible extensions. Depending on personal preference, you can choose between immediate purchase and payment in monthly installments based on financing from our cooperation partner Deutsche Bank AG.

title: Downloads - Smart Wallbox Product Sheet
answer: Download the SmartWallbox product sheet

title: Photovoltaics - What Happens After Placing an Order?
answer: After placing your order, we ask you to upload some photos of your house, roof, and distribution box using a precise guide - based on this, the zholar planning team conducts a comprehensive expert check of your order. Since zholar also completely takes care of network applications for you, you will then be asked by email for some additional information and to sign a power of attorney. From this point on, as a zholar customer, you can sit back, as the zholar experts take care of everything else.

title: Photovoltaics - Do I have to complete the order in one go, or can I reconsider it after configuring my system, before placing the order?
answer: After selecting the product, you naturally have the option to save your PV planning. You will then receive a link via email and can continue the ordering process at any time with this.

title: Photovoltaics - I wanted to switch back to the previous step in the planning assistant using the "Back" button and ended up back on the zholar website. What should I do?
answer: Your previous entries have been saved and you can return to the planning assistant using the "Forward" button of the browser. There, please use the "Back" button in the lower left corner of the dialog box to switch back to completed planning steps.

title: Photovoltaics - I have questions about the ordering process – who can I contact?
answer: The zholar support team is available to assist you via email at support@zholar.de or by phone at +43 1 2264424801. You can also request a callback there.

title: Photovoltaics - Are zholar Solutions Also Offered for Commercial/Business Customers?
answer: Our focus is entirely on private customers, we currently only offer the zholar solutions for this customer group.

title: Photovoltaics - Is there personal on-site consultation available?
answer: Personal consultation is extremely important to us - as part of our telephone consultations, our energy experts provide free and professional advice on all relevant questions about your project. From our experience with 3,000 installed zholar systems, we know exactly what is important in PV planning and what information is needed. This information is requested during the ordering process and subsequently checked by our planning team. Thus, the planning of a PV system is greatly simplified for you. After the order, we quickly check the basic feasibility of the ordered PV system based on the provided photos & information. At the customer's request, a personal inspection appointment with their zholar installation partner is possible immediately after this expert check. During this appointment, there is ample opportunity to discuss any questions about the

title: Photovoltaics - Why is it sensible to plan and order a PV system online?
answer: Based on our experience with 3,000 installed zholar systems, all of which are based on online orders, we know exactly what is important in PV planning and what information is needed. We are convinced that planning a PV system does not have to be complicated or costly - therefore, we not only offer a very attractive price, but also a greatly simplified ordering and planning process via the zholar website. In this way, we can best achieve our goal of significantly simplifying your path to renewable energy solutions. In addition to the online process, a site visit by the zholar installation partner naturally takes place before the installation. During this, all details relevant to the execution are discussed and defined.

title: Photovoltaics - Can I Cancel the Order?
answer: Yes. You can cancel your order at any time, even up to 14 days after installation, without giving any reason. Such a cancellation is free of charge for you, provided it is made immediately before the start of installation. However, if you declare the cancellation only after the installation, please note that in this case you will have to bear the costs of assembly and disassembly, a loss in value of the PV system, and possibly the costs of additional services. For a more detailed description, please read the purchase contract or the terms and conditions.

title: Photovoltaics - Is my order connected to a Zholar subscription? Do I need to have a subscription to use the Zholar offer?
answer: Zholar solutions are available to everyone, independent of a Zholar newspaper subscription. However, Zholar subscribers who enter their subscription number during the ordering process will receive a 50 € credit from Zholar after the installation of the PV system.

title: Photovoltaics - Is it possible to order one product (e.g. the PV system) as an immediate purchase and another product (e.g. storage) as a credit purchase?
answer: No, that is not possible. Based on your product selection, you can decide for the entire selected package whether you want to make an immediate purchase or pay for your zholar solution through a monthly installment plan.

title: Photovoltaics - Is it possible to order zholarMax, zholarMarry, zholarMarry XL, or zholarMarry XXL multiple times per household?
answer: Only one zholar PV package can be selected per household.

title: Photovoltaics - How Much Energy Does the Photovoltaic System Generate?
answer: Depending on the roof orientation, location, and shading situation, the zholar PV systems deliver the following average energy yield per year: zholarMax: approx. 3,000 kWh zholarMarry: approx. 5,000 kWh zholarMarry XL: approx. 8,000 kWh zholarMarryXXL: approx. 10,000 kWh

title: Photovoltaics - Where can I see how much energy my PV system is producing?
answer: You can view the production data of your PV system at any time via an app on your smartphone. This requires a Wi-Fi connection of the inverter. With our energy monitoring solution in conjunction with the BE SpareFlo Pro app (available as an extension), you can gain an even more comprehensive overview.

title: Photovoltaics - How big and heavy is a photovoltaic module?
answer: The dimensions of a PV module are approximately 180x110x3 cm with a weight of about 20 kg.

title: Photovoltaics - Which Modules are Used?
answer: 400 - 425 Watt monocrystalline brand modules. 12-year manufacturer's warranty as well as a 25-year linear performance guarantee from the manufacturer (the modules still deliver about 80% of the original nominal output after 25 years, with the nominal output decreasing linearly on average).

title: Photovoltaics - Which Inverters Does Zholar Use?
answer: Powerful three-phase brand inverter, rated output power 3 / 5 / 8 /10 kW, efficiency ≥ 96%, suitable for storage expansion, 2 MPP trackers, Wi-Fi capable. Manufacturer Huawei or technically comparable.

title: Photovoltaics - Am I independent of the power grid during a blackout?
answer: No. The photovoltaic system is grid-tied and does not operate independently from the power grid. However, we have already prepared for the future, as the inverter used by zholar is suitable for the use of a battery storage and a grid disconnection (blackout box). See FAQ on the Sissi storage or our Blackout Box for more details on this topic.

title: Photovoltaics - Is there a maintenance package for the PV system?
answer: Yes, as part of the ordering process, you can expand your zholar PV system with a maintenance package. See the "Maintenance Product Sheet" for details.

title: Photovoltaics - Does the system only produce electricity when the sun is shining?
answer: No, a photovoltaic system also generates power even when it's cloudy.

title: Photovoltaics - What exactly does the Zholar PV package include?
answer: All zholar PV packages include the application for the grid access contract with the responsible grid operator, the standard roof-parallel mounting, and the ready-to-use installation of the PV system by a zholar installation partner, including the creation of the system documentation. See "Product Sheet Photovoltaics" for details.

title: Photovoltaics - Do you have to clean the solar cells?
answer: No, the tilt angle allows the PV modules to clean themselves in the rain.

title: Photovoltaics - I would like an even larger PV system. Is this possible and how do I proceed?
answer: The Zholar PV packages are designed so that a sensibly sized system can be selected for every typical need in the private sector (ZholarMax 3 kWp, Zholar Marie 5 kWp, ZholarMarry XL 8 kWp and ZholarMarry XXL 10 kWp). We currently do not offer any larger packages. However, during the installation, the installation of up to two additional modules can be agreed upon in coordination with the installation partner (Zholar network applications remain unaffected by this).

title: Photovoltaics - What warranty or guarantee provisions apply?
answer: In addition to the statutory warranty, our modules come with a 12-year manufacturer's warranty and a 25-year performance warranty. The inverter has a 15-year manufacturer's warranty.

title: Photovoltaics - What happens if a component should be defective?
answer: If this should occur during or before the completion of the installation, your zholar installation partner is directly available to assist you. After the installation is completed, please contact the zholar customer support at support@zholar.de.

title: Photovoltaics - Can a Battery Storage Be Retrofitted?
answer: Yes, the inverter used by Zholar is ready for use with storage. You can also make the Zholar PV basic package even more powerful during your order by expanding the storage with ZholarSissi (5, 10, and 15 kWh capacity). The PV system and storage are usually installed together. Alternatively, storage can be easily and conveniently retrofitted to an existing Zholar PV system at any time.

title: Photovoltaics - I already have a (power) grid connection. Why do I need to apply for a new grid access?
answer: Without a PV system, you exclusively draw power from the grid. This is regulated in your existing network access. With your PV system, you produce your own electricity and feed the portion that you do not consume into the grid. This is regulated with the new network access and you receive a separate meter point for feeding your surplus PV electricity into the grid.

title: Photovoltaics - How long does it take for the network operator to process the grid access application?
answer: The network operators have a legal deadline of four weeks for this. However, from zholar's experience with thousands of network applications, we know that this can sometimes take significantly longer and in individual cases even several months. Of course, zholar stays on the ball to reduce the processing time for our customers as much as possible. It is pleasing that the processing times are currently improving significantly.

title: Photovoltaics - How long does it take to install the system?
answer: The installation time of your PV system depends on the approval of your network operator and the zholar installation planning. Based on current average values, the installation of your PV system takes place within approximately 2 to 3 months from the complete order. Weather conditions can cause this average duration to vary seasonally.

title: Photovoltaics - How does the installation of the PV system proceed?
answer: The installation of the PV system takes about one working day in total (excluding any additional services that may be required). Depending on the approach of the zholar installation partner, the process can also be divided into several stages. First, during an on-site inspection, the placement of the modules and the cable routes will be discussed with you. This is followed by the roof mounting of the modules, the wiring from the modules to the inverter, and then from the inverter to the meter/fuse box. Once the installation is complete, a technical inspection is carried out, including a test protocol along with instruction and handover of the PV system. The test protocol will be sent to you after the installation has been checked and approved by zholar.

title: Photovoltaics - Who installs the system or do I have to do it myself? Is there a guide for this?
answer: Your PV system will be installed turnkey by a licensed partner company ("zholar installation partner") as part of a ready-to-operate standard installation. After the installation is completed, you will receive an introduction to the PV system. Any additional services required for the PV installation to ensure the customer's electrical system is up to date will be arranged directly with the executing zholar installation partner as a licensed electrical company and possibly commissioned by them.

title: Photovoltaics - What's Next After the Installation of the System?
answer: After the installation of your PV system, zholar or the executing zholar installation partner will arrange for the completion report of the system to the network operator. The duration until the actual commissioning depends on the network operator (in some cases a meter exchange by the network operator is necessary, etc.) and unfortunately cannot be influenced by zholar. Due to the high workload on the part of the network operators, this phase can take several weeks.

title: Photovoltaics - Will there be an inspection of my house before the installation of the system?
answer: Yes. Typically, a site visit takes place before the actual installation appointment. During this visit, you and the installation partner will inspect your roof and discuss the positioning of the modules, the cable routes, and the mounting location for the inverter. Any additional services that may be required will also be discussed at this time. Once all the details have been clarified, the installation begins.

title: Photovoltaics - What construction measures will be necessary for installation? Will anything be drilled into my house facade or roof?
answer: Your PV system will be installed by a licensed company. In this process, the modules will be attached to your roof with the appropriate substructure. The wiring from the modules to the inverter and from the inverter to the meter/fuse box is surface-mounted. If your house has an existing, technically suitable conduit, this can also be used.

title: Photovoltaics - Will I also receive documentation?
answer: Of course! After the installation and handover of the ready-to-use photovoltaic system, the installation is checked by zholar based on the completion report from the zholar installation partner. We then send you the entire documentation consisting of the test report, handover protocol, data sheets, and photo documentation.

title: Photovoltaics - Which installation partner will assemble my system?
answer: We will send you the deposit invoice in good time before the planned installation. Afterwards, your project will be handed over to one of our zholar installation partners who will contact you directly to arrange an installation appointment. Thanks to our powerful partner network, we mainly work with regionally based companies that are well acquainted with the regional specifics.

title: Photovoltaics - Is the surge protection part of the zholar PV package?
answer: Yes, a Type II DC surge protector is part of every zholar system. See the PV product sheet for details.

title: Photovoltaics - Where is the Inverter Installed?
answer: A wall mounting is carried out. The installation is done according to the manufacturer's specifications; preferably in an unoccupied room (e.g., utility room, garage, etc.). You define the exact location together with the zholar installation partner directly before the installation.

title: Photovoltaics - Do I need to be present during the installation?
answer: Yes, at least before the start of installation (to discuss module placement, cable routes, etc.) and during the electrical installation, your presence is required.

title: Photovoltaics - What happens when the originally planned number of modules for the roof doesn't fit?
answer: Customers and the zholar installation partner can agree on the installation of a number of modules that is increased or reduced compared to the zholar standard package, based on local conditions and taking into account technical specifications. If the system is implemented with a reduced number of modules and thus smaller than provided in the standard package, a credit for each less installed module will be issued to the customer by zholar as part of the final billing.

title: Photovoltaics - As a Zholar customer, am I limited in choosing my energy supplier?
answer: No. With your zholar PV system, you are not limited, but rather taking a big step towards renewable energy independence. As before, you can freely choose your energy supplier. This applies to both the supply from the public grid and the feed-in of surplus PV electricity.

title: Photovoltaics - Will I still receive an electricity bill? Will I be energy self-sufficient or do I still need an additional electricity provider?
answer: Your existing contractual relationship with your energy supplier remains unaffected by the PV system, as a PV system - even if equipped with a storage - only covers a part of the electricity demand.

title: Photovoltaics - What happens to the generated but unused electricity?
answer: The unused electricity (surplus) is fed into the power grid. For this, you receive a compensation per fed-in kWh from your electricity provider.

title: Photovoltaics - Can I choose who I sell my PV surplus power to?
answer: Yes, you can choose the company that buys your excess electricity. This can be your existing electricity supplier or any other energy supplier. As a solar provider, we also offer an attractive rate for the purchase of your PV surplus in partnership with Better Energy in the future.

title: Photovoltaics - What do I need to do to conclude the surplus tariff with "Better Energy"?
answer: As soon as we receive the metering point number for your PV feed-in from the network operator, we will provide you with all the information about our surplus tariff. If desired, you can then conclude this with just a few clicks.

title: Photovoltaics - How is it regulated with my regular electricity bill?
answer: Your regular electricity bill is reduced by the amount of electricity you directly draw from your PV system.

title: Photovoltaics - How much solar power do I use myself? Will I be able to cover my entire electricity needs with the system?
