answer: "An average 2-person household with an annual electricity consumption of 3,500 kWh and a zholarMax 3 kWp PV system consumes approximately 35% (1,100 kWh) of the solar power it generates. An average 4-person household with an annual electricity consumption of 5,000 kWh and a zholarMarry 5 kWp PV system consumes approximately 31% (1,700 kWh) of the solar power it generates. An average 4-person household with an annual electricity consumption of 8,000 kWh and a zholarMarry XL 8 kWp PV system consumes approximately 30% (2,400 kWh) of the solar power it generates. An average 4-person household with an

title: Photovoltaics - Is there also a financing solution?
answer: Yes, together with our financing partner Deutsche Bank AG, we offer an attractive credit purchase solution for your zholar order - 12 years loan term and fixed interest rate.

title: Photovoltaics - How long does the loan agreement run?
answer: The term is 12 years.

title: Photovoltaics - How Exactly Does Credit Purchase Work?
answer: After completing the zholar order and passing the expert check, you will receive a link via email to apply for your financing directly with our financing partner, UniCredit Bank Austria. This can be done online, or if preferred, you can visit a bank branch. After successful completion of the financing, the bank will inform zholar and the order processing (application for network access, etc.) by zholar will begin. The down payment to be made before the PV installation is to be paid directly to zholar, and the further payments to zholar in connection with your PV system will be made directly by the bank. From the installation of your PV system, you will pay the agreed installments to the bank.

title: Photovoltaics - When are the installments due for a loan purchase?
answer: The first installment is due only after the installation of the PV system.

title: Photovoltaics - Is the system mine when purchased with a loan or what should I be aware of?
answer: Yes, the PV system is your property from the beginning.

title: Photovoltaics - I would like to make a credit purchase at zholar. Is it possible for another person to close my loan at the bank?
answer: No, unfortunately not. It is important that the Zholar customer is the same person as the bank customer.

title: Photovoltaics - To what extent is flexible repayment of the loan possible?
answer: Early repayment or partial repayment is possible under the defined conditions of the loan agreement.

title: Photovoltaics - What documents need to be provided for the bank's credit check?
answer: Proof of salary (the last three pay slips or the last pension notice), online verification (you need a passport or ID card, smartphone) or verification at the branch (you need a passport, ID card).

title: Photovoltaics - How long does the credit check take approximately?
answer: Approximately three bank business days after all documents have been submitted.

title: Photovoltaics - 0% Sales Tax – What Does This Mean and Is It Automatically Considered?
answer: The reduction of sales tax to 0% applies to PV systems, storage, and installation - in the course of new construction. This measure replaces federal funding and is limited to two years (until the end of 2025). The sales tax exemption is automatically taken into account in the billing.

title: Photovoltaics - When is the payment made to Zholar?
answer: The reduction of sales tax to 0% applies to PV systems, storage, and installation - in the course of new construction. This measure replaces federal funding and is limited to two years (until the end of 2025). The sales tax exemption is automatically taken into account in the billing.

title: Photovoltaics - What happens if the ordered solar PV system cannot be installed?
answer: Particularly due to our preliminary checks, this case is rather unlikely. However, if it does happen, your order will naturally be canceled free of charge and any payments already made will be fully refunded within 14 days. In the case of a credit purchase, this will also be reversed free of charge.

title: Photovoltaics - Who is Behind Zholar?
answer: Two leading companies in the country - Zholar and Burgenland Energie - are combining their strengths in the joint venture zholar GmbH.

title: Photovoltaics - Are the zholar Energy Solutions Available Nationwide?
answer: Yes. The zholar renewable energy solutions are available throughout Austria and the more than a thousand zholar installations are accordingly distributed across the entire federal territory.

title: Photovoltaics - What Orientation Should My Roof Have?
answer: The optimal orientation is to the south, however, a system with east or west orientation also provides a reasonably good yield. We advise against a north orientation for efficiency reasons. Occupying two roof surfaces (e.g. east and west) is possible in the case of zholarMarry, zholarMarry XL, and zholarMarryXXL.

title: Photovoltaics - How much roof area do I need for a solar PV package?
answer: For zholarMax (approx. 3 kWp), about 16 m2 is required on a continuous roof side. For zholarMarry (approx. 5 kWp), about 26 m2 is required, for zholarMarry XL (approx. 8 kWp), about 42 m2 is required, and for zholarMarry XXL (approx. 10 kWp), about 52 m2 is required. In the case of the last two packages, a division on two roof surfaces is generally possible. Important: the area must be free of obstructions such as dormers, skylights, ventilation, etc. For details, see "Product Sheet Photovoltaics".

title: Photovoltaics - Under what conditions can zholarMax, zholarMarry, zholarMarry XL, zholarMarry XXL be installed?
answer: An overview of the structural/technical requirements for the zholar PV solutions can be found in the "Photovoltaics Product Sheet". To check with a few clicks whether your house is suitable, simply visit our website www.zholar.de and start the planning assistant.

title: Photovoltaics - Why is the PV System Not Suitable for All Roofs?
answer: Our PV solutions are packages with a predefined standard installation, which is suitable for the majority of houses. The effort for the installation varies greatly depending on the existing roof covering. For this reason, the PV systems can only be implemented on the listed roof coverings within the scope of this offer.

title: Photovoltaics - Can the Panels be Mounted on the Facade or Set Up in the Garden?
answer: The Zholar PV solutions are exclusively suitable and designed for roof mounting (parallel to the roof). Alternatively, our balcony power plant, Zholar SolMate, can be an attractive solution for facade, balcony, or garden.

title: Photovoltaics - How much space do I need in the house for the inverter?
answer: The size of the inverter varies depending on the size of the package. The 8 kW inverter for zholarMarry XL requires approximately 55x50x15 cm of space and is intended for wall mounting. The inverters for zholarMax or zholarMarry are slightly smaller, while the zholarMarry XXL is slightly larger.

title: Photovoltaics - Do I need a Wi-Fi internet connection to operate a PV system?
answer: No, the PV system can also be operated without a Wi-Fi internet connection. However, using the smartphone app (to monitor your system's production) does require a Wi-Fi internet connection.

title: Photovoltaics - Are all building types suitable for a solar PV package?
answer: Basically, single or multi-family houses, semi-detached or terraced houses, small garden houses, and garages are suitable for zholar PV solutions. Important: for installation reasons, the eaves height must not exceed 8 m.

title: Photovoltaics - Are all roof types suitable for a solar PV package?
answer: The Zholar PV packages are designed for gable roof, shed roof & hip roof. Solutions for other roof types are being prepared, but are not currently offered. Interested parties will be informed as soon as they are available.

title: Photovoltaics - Are all types of roofing suitable for a solar PV package?
answer: Suitable for zholar PV solutions are tile/concrete tile with simple coverage, corrugated Eternit, Eternit Toscana, trapezoidal sheet metal & sheet metal fold. Flat roofs and PREFA roofs are also possible, and the feasibility of other types of roofs is individually checked upon request by the zholar expert team.

title: Photovoltaics - What should be considered for trapezoidal sheet metal/standing seam roofs?
answer: In case of need, proof of standard-compliant roof installation must be provided for these roof coverings to ensure the static load capacity even with the installed PV system. Alternatively, a stud bolt assembly can be carried out.

title: Photovoltaics - What to Consider for Flat Roofs?
answer: To secure PV systems on flat roofs against shifting and lifting, they must be ballasted. The ballasting plan required for flat roof mounting of the module substructure (based on regional wind and snow loads in combination with roof height, roof area, etc.) is part of the zholar service scope. The cost of the stones used as the appropriate ballast for your flat roof PV system is not covered by the zholar PV package and will be charged to you directly by the zholar installation partner. The cost of a possibly required suitability confirmation regarding the roof statics is also not covered by the zholar service scope (the construction of your (flat) roof must have a sufficient roof load reserve for the installation of a PV system, taking into account

title: Photovoltaics - What to Consider with PREFA Roofs?
answer: Work on PREFA roofs can only be carried out by roofing companies that are certified by the manufacturer. The top priority is to ensure a standard-compliant and durable installation, therefore it is adapted for zholar PV solutions on PREFA roofs - see product sheet.

title: Photovoltaics - What additional services in the field of electrical installation might be necessary? Who provides these?
answer: The establishment of a photovoltaic (PV) system is considered a significant modification/expansion of an existing electrical system under Austrian law. As soon as an existing electrical system is altered, for example, by a PV installation, the entire system must comply with the current state of technology to obtain the test protocol. It is possible that your electrical system may require additional services to achieve this necessary current state of technology for a positive test protocol and commissioning of the PV system. Such additional services are not covered by the zholar scope of services. These additional services may include remodeling or renewing the fuse box, additional DC surge protector type 2 for DC cabling >10m or DC surge protector type 1+2 if technically necessary (with existing

title: Photovoltaics - Will there be additional costs on top of the purchase price?
answer: Should additional services be necessary to carry out a standard-compliant installation or/and to bring the customer's electrical system up to the required technical standard, our installation partner will inform you of the necessary additional services and the resulting costs directly during the inspection before the installation. You are not obligated to commission these additional services and can withdraw from the contract in this case. In the event of a contract withdrawal, we will refund your already made down payment to zholar within 14 days to your specified account.

title: Photovoltaics - When is the Need and Scope of Possible Additional Services Determined?
answer: During the inspection appointment, directly with sufficient lead time before the installation.

title: Clean Energy Financing
answer: Clean Energy Financing: Making Sustainable Energy Affordable Transitioning to clean energy has never been easier with flexible financing options designed to fit your budget. Whether you’re a homeowner or a business owner, our solutions make clean energy projects achievable and cost-effective. Financing Solutions Accessible Options for Everyone We provide various financing solutions tailored to your needs, including: •   Solar Loans: Competitive rates and flexible terms. •   Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs): Zero upfront costs with predictable payments. •   Lease Options: Affordable monthly payments and performance guarantees. Our experts will guide you through the financing process to ensure you choose the best option for your clean energy transition.  Compare financing options Solar Loans Flexible and Affordable Solar loans provide upfront funding for your project, allowing you to: •   Own your system outright. •   Take advantage of tax credits and rebates. •   Pay over time with competitive rates and flexible terms. Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) Energy Without Upfront Costs With a PPA, you can enjoy clean energy benefits without the initial investment. Key advantages include: •   Fixed energy payments over the contract term. •   Professional maintenance and system monitoring. •   Zero ownership responsibilities. Lease Options Affordable and Hassle-Free Leasing allows you to access clean energy with low monthly payments. Benefits include: •   Equipment upgrades during the lease term. •   Performance guarantees for peace of mind. •   No need to manage system ownership or maintenance. Why Choose Clean Energy Financing? •   Cost Savings: Lower energy bills and predictable payments. •   Accessibility: Solutions for different budgets and energy goals. •   Sustainability: Enable your transition to renewable energy without financial strain.  Explore financing options  Calculate your savings Clean energy financing makes it easier than ever to take the first step toward a sustainable future. With flexible plans and expert guidance, you can start saving money and reducing your environmental impact today.

title: Backup Power Guide
answer: Backup Power Guide Ensure your home remains powered during outages with reliable backup power solutions tailored to your needs. Home Battery Systems Store energy for use during power outages with advanced battery solutions. Standby Generators Automatically supply power to your home when the grid goes down. Portable Generators Flexible and mobile power sources for temporary backup needs.Consider factors such as essential appliances, duration of potential outages, and budget to make an informed decision.

title: Heating and  cooling
answer: Heating & cooling Explore heat pumps, the latest in clean heating and cooling technology. Improve your energy efficiency and stay comfortable - all year long. What's a heat pump? Efficient heating and cooling solution An air source heat pump is a great way to heat and cool your space (yeah, it does both!). This electric-based technology can work in any home and works more efficiently than traditional HVAC systems. Also known as mini-splits. Heat and cool your whole home or specific rooms with small indoor "heads" or air handling units.

title: Home Energy Storage Guide
answer: Home Energy Storage Guide Learn how battery storage systems can enhance your home's energy independence and provide reliable backup power. How Energy Storage Works Understanding Battery Systems Modern home battery systems provide multiple benefits: • Store excess solar production for nighttime use • Provide backup power during grid outages • Enable peak-shaving to reduce utility bills • Support grid services for additional income Battery systems can be installed with new solar panels or retrofitted to existing solar installations. Smart controls optimize charging and discharging based on your energy needs and utility rates. Battery Technologies Choosing the Right Solution Modern home energy storage options include: • Lithium-ion batteries: Most common, offering excellent performance and lifespan • Lead-acid batteries: Traditional technology, lower cost but shorter lifespan • Flow batteries: Emerging technology with promising scalability Key factors in selecting a battery system include: • Capacity and power output • Round-trip efficiency • Warranty and expected lifespan • Installation requirements • Cost and available incentives Cost and Savings Investment and Returns Battery storage system costs typically range from $8,000 to $20,000, depending on capacity and features. Cost factors include: • Battery capacity and power rating • Installation complexity • Additional equipment needs • Available incentives and tax credits Return on investment comes from: • Reduced utility bills through peak-shaving • Backup power value • Grid services participation • Solar self-consumption optimization

title: EV Charging Guide
answer: EV Charging Guide: Keeping Your EV Ready for the Road Electric vehicle (EV) charging is essential for maintaining your EV’s range and performance. Explore the various charging options, including home installations, public stations, and fast charging, to keep your vehicle powered up. Home Charging Stations Convenience at Home Set up a home charging station to easily charge your EV overnight. With a Level 2 charger, you can add 10-25 miles of range per hour, ensuring a full battery every morning. 👉 Explore home charging options Public Charging Networks On-the-Go Charging Access an expanding network of public chargers for quick top-ups while you’re on the road. Many stations support Level 2 and Level 3 (DC Fast Charging), offering flexibility for longer trips. Fast Charging Options Rapid Recharge DC fast charging stations allow you to add 60-100 miles of range in just 20 minutes. Ideal for long-distance travel and emergencies, these stations are commonly found in public locations. Understanding EV Charging Levels Choose the Right Speed for Your Needs •   Level 1: Standard 120V outlet; adds 2-5 miles per hour. •   Level 2: 240V outlet; adds 10-25 miles per hour. •   Level 3 (DC Fast Charging): Rapid charging; adds 60-100 miles in 20 minutes. Benefits of Home EV Charging 1.   Convenience: Charge at home, on your schedule. 2.   Cost Savings: Lower electricity rates and potential incentives. 3.   Time Efficiency: Avoid time spent waiting at public chargers. Installing a Home Charging Station Follow These Steps for Setup 1.   Assess Electrical Capacity: Ensure compatibility with a Level 2 charger. 2.   Select a Charger: Choose one that suits your EV and preferences. 3.   Hire a Professional: Ensure safe, code-compliant installation. 4.   Apply for Incentives: Research rebates or tax credits for home chargers. 👉 Find local installers Utilizing Public Charging Networks 1.   Join a Network: Access chargers via memberships with networks like ChargePoint or Electrify America. 2.   Use Mobile Apps: Locate, check availability, and monitor sessions. 3.   Choose Payment Options: Pay per use or subscribe for savings. With these options, you can ensure your EV stays ready for any journey. Embrace the flexibility and efficiency of modern EV charging solutions today!

Benefits of Home EV Charging 1.   Convenience: Charge at home, on your schedule. 2.   Cost Savings: Lower electricity rates and potential incentives. 3.   Time Efficiency: Avoid time spent waiting at public chargers. Installing a Home Charging Station Follow These Steps for Setup 1.   Assess Electrical Capacity: Ensure compatibility with a Level 2 charger. 2.   Select a Charger: Choose one that suits your EV and preferences. 3.   Hire a Professional: Ensure safe, code-compliant installation. 4.   Apply for Incentives: Research rebates or tax credits for home chargers. 👉 Find local installers Utilizing Public Charging Networks 1.   Join a Network: Access chargers via memberships with networks like ChargePoint or Electrify America. 2.   Use Mobile Apps: Locate, check availability, and monitor sessions. 3.   Choose Payment Options: Pay per use or subscribe for savings. With these options, you can ensure your EV stays ready for any journey. Embrace the flexibility and efficiency of modern EV charging solutions today!

title: Community Solar Guide  Save on Energy Without Installing Panels
answer: Community Solar Guide: Save on Energy Without Installing Panels Community solar programs offer an innovative way to enjoy the benefits of solar energy without needing to install panels on your property. Learn how these programs work and how they can help you save on energy costs while supporting renewable energy in your community. What is Community Solar? Shared Solar Energy for All Community solar allows multiple participants to share the benefits of a single solar array, often located off-site. Subscribers earn credits on their electricity bills based on their share of the power produced, leading to savings and promoting clean energy growth. 👉 Learn more How Does It Work? Simple Steps to Start Saving 1.   Subscribe: Select a local community solar project and sign up for a portion of its energy production. 2.   Energy Generation: The solar farm produces electricity and feeds it into the grid. 3.   Bill Credits: Receive credits on your electricity bill for your share of the solar energy. 4.   Savings: Pay the solar provider at a discounted rate, resulting in net energy savings. 👉 Find local projects Benefits of Community Solar 1.   No Installation Required: Enjoy solar energy without installing panels. 2.   Cost Savings: Save 5-20% on annual electricity costs. 3.   Accessibility: Perfect for renters, condo owners, or those with unsuitable roofs. 4.   Support Local Clean Energy: Contribute to renewable energy growth in your community. 5.   Flexibility: Easy enrollment with no maintenance or long-term commitments. Flexible Subscription Options Tailored to Your Needs Choose a plan that fits your energy needs and budget, offering a flexible and hassle-free way to embrace solar power. Take advantage of community solar to reduce your energy costs, support renewable energy, and make a positive environmental impact—without the need for installation or maintenance.

title: Solar Panel Cost Guide
answer: Solar Panel Cost Guide: Understand Your Investment Investing in solar panels involves more than just upfront costs. Learn about equipment, installation, regional variations, and long-term savings to make an informed decision about your solar investment. Average System Costs What to Expect Residential solar systems typically cost between $15,000 and $25,000 after federal tax incentives, depending on system size and location.  Calculate your costs Cost Per Watt Breaking Down Pricing The national average cost per watt ranges from $2.50 to $3.50, influenced by equipment quality and local market conditions. Payback Period Achieve Financial Returns Most homeowners recover their investment within 5-10 years through energy savings and available incentives, making solar a smart long-term choice. title: Heat Pump Guide
answer: Heat Pump Guide: Efficient Heating and Cooling for Your Home Heat pumps are an energy-efficient solution for heating and cooling, providing year-round comfort while lowering energy consumption and reducing your carbon footprint. Learn how they work, their benefits, and how to choose the best system for your home. How Do Heat Pumps Work? Efficient Climate Control Heat pumps transfer heat between your home and the outside air, offering heating in the winter and cooling in the summer. Instead of generating heat, they move it, making them a cost-effective and energy-efficient choice for climate control.  Learn more Types of Heat Pumps Choosing the Right System 1.   Air Source Heat Pumps: Extract heat from the air, ideal for moderate climates. 2.   Ground Source (Geothermal) Heat Pumps: Use the earth’s stable temperature for consistent efficiency. 3.   Ductless Mini-Split Heat Pumps: Provide zoned heating and cooling without ductwork—perfect for retrofits or home additions.  Compare heat pump types Benefits of Installing a Heat Pump Why Choose a Heat Pump? 1.   Cost Savings: Reduce energy bills with high-efficiency operation. 2.   Dual Functionality: One system for both heating and cooling. 3.   Low Maintenance: Fewer mechanical components mean reduced maintenance needs. 4.   Safety: No combustion process, eliminating risks associated with gas heating.  Discover more benefits How to Choose the Right Heat Pump Key Factors to Consider 1.   Climate: Select a system suited for temperature extremes in your region. 2.   Home Size and Insulation: Proper sizing is crucial for efficiency and comfort. 3.   Budget: Balance upfront costs with potential energy savings and available incentives. 4.   Professional Consultation: Work with certified installers to find the best fit for your home.  Find local installers A heat pump is a versatile and environmentally friendly option for year-round comfort. By understanding your needs and the available systems, you can make an informed decision and enjoy efficient, cost-effective climate control in your home.
